Arena rewards for the previous season
can be claimed by entering the Arena
after the results have been calculated
for the previous season and before
the current season ends.

Duel Rivals around the World:
Choose from three rival armies to
start a challenge. Requires one
Dueling Sword to battle.

How Scoring Works:
If you win, you'll earn points
based on the strength of your foe.
During a winning streak, you'll get
a chain bonus. This bonus resets
after your seventh straight win.

Your High Score:
Go for a personal best each
season. This score resets
at the end of this period.

Rewards:
After the season ends, you'll get
rewards based on your high
score and ranking. If your score
is high enough, your Arena tier
may go up.

Character Bonus:
You can double your score each
season by using certain characters.

Defense Results:
When your team defends
successfully, you'll earn a defense
bonus.

Defense Rewards:
The season reward is based on
your highest score.

Defense Team:
Your team in the far-left slot will
be used as your defense team.

Checking Rewards:
You can check the rewards that
will be given out for the current
season. Change the filter to see
rewards given for your offense,
defense, and rank.

Offense Rewards:
These rewards are based on the
score you've earned for attacks.

Defense Rewards:
These rewards are based on the
score your team has earned
for defense.

Rank Rewards:
These rewards are based on your
Arena ranking. The top 100,000
scores are ranked and are
calculated at the start of every
hour. Note that it may take some
time to reflect changes after the
calculations begin.

Receiving Rewards:
You can receive Arena rewards
you earned in the previous season
by entering the Arena after that
season's results have been
calculated but before the current
season ends.

Earn EXP! Get Shards and Badges!

Training Tower:
The Training Tower is a great
place for getting lots of EXP for
your allies.

Training Tower Basics:
Enemies and maps can change
each time you battle. So before a
battle, check the enemy types and
then create an effective team.

Training Tower Rewards:
Some rewards let you level up
allies. Others let you unlock
ally potential.

There are many specific kinds of
rewards in those categories.
They change based on the day.

Shards/Crystals on First Clear:
You'll get a Shard or a Crystal the
first time you clear a stage each
day. These items level up allies.

You can get Crystals only from
the Sixth Stratum and higher.

Badge for Each Clear:
Each time you clear a stage, you'll
get a Badge or a Great Badge.
These items unlock an ally's
potential (measured in ★).

You can get Great Badges only
from the Sixth Stratum and higher.

You will earn less EXP and SP on this
map since you have already cleared it.

and the Orb requirements will reset.

Merge same allies for SP and potentially stat boosts.

$aRaise stats of target ally and
give it $a0 SP?

When merging allies of the same ★ rating,
or if the source ally's ★ rating is higher,
the remaining ally gains both raised stats
and SP. Otherwise, they gain only SP.

Editing Teams:
You can edit the teams you send
out to battle. The ally in the
leftmost slot is the leader.

Adding Allies:
To add an ally to a team, tap a
slot and then tap the ally.

Removing Allies:
To remove an ally from a team,
select the ally then tap Undo.

Switching Teams:
Tap the arrow on the left or right
of the team slots to switch teams.

Ally Profiles:
Hold down on an ally to view
its profile.

Learning Skills:
Allies can learn new skills if you
expend their Skill Points (SP).

Earning Skill Points:
Allies earn SP when they defeat
an enemy in battle and also
when they level up.

Unlocking Potential:
Allies can access more powerful
skills to learn by using the
Unlock Potential feature.

Equipping Skills:
You can change the skills your
allies have equipped for battle.

Active and Passive Skills:
Some skills are active skills,
which means that they activate
through your actions. Others
are passive. These take effect
just by equipping them.

Types of Active Skills:
There are three types of active
skills: Weapon, Assist, and
Special. You can use these
through your battle actions
once they're equipped.

Types of Passive Skills:
There are three types of passive
skills: Misc. A, Misc. B, and
Misc. C. These skills take effect
after you equip them. You can
equip one skill for each type.
Use Shards and Crystals to level up!

Leveling Up with Items:
You can level up your allies by
using Shards and Crystals.

Shard and Crystal Types:
You must use a type of Shard or
Crystal that works with your
ally's type. Universal Shards
and Universal Crystals can be
used on allies of any type.

Using Shards and Crystals:
Shards are needed to level allies
that are level 19 and lower.
Crystals are needed for level 20
and higher. You can get Crystals
in the Training Tower's Sixth
Stratum and higher.

Sending Allies Home:
You can get Hero Feathers in
exchange for allies you send
back to their worlds. You will
lose these allies permanently.

Favoriting Allies:
If you favorite an ally, you cannot
send the ally home or use it in
any way that results in your
losing the ally permanently.

How to Favorite an Ally:
To favorite an ally, tap on the
heart mark in the upper left of
its ally profile then select the
preferred heart color. Tap
Remove to remove it.

Unlocking Ally Potential:
If you raise an ally's ★ rating, you'll
unlock more of its potential. The
ally must be level 20 or higher.
You'll need specific items.

Its level will return to 1, but at a
higher ★ rating, it will have raised
stats and access to stronger skills.

1★ to 3★ Allies:
To raise the ★ rating of these
allies, you'll need Hero Feathers
(which you can get in many ways,
including from Arena battles)
and Badges (which you can get
in the Training Tower).

4★ Allies:
To raise the ★ rating of these
allies, you'll need Hero Feathers
and Great Badges. You can get
Great Badges from the Sixth
Stratum or higher in the Training
Tower.

Loss of Stats from Merging:
Please note that when you raise
an ally's ★ rating, the ally's stat
increases from merging will
be lost.

Merging Allies:
You can raise an ally's stats
and gain SP by combining it
with an ally that has the same
name and title. The source ally
is lost in the process.

Raising Stats:
If the allies have the same ★ rating
or the source ally's ★ rating is
higher, the remaining ally will get
raised stats and gain SP. If not, the
remaining ally will only gain SP.

If the remaining ally's ★ rating is
then raised with Unlock Potential,
these raised stats will be lost.
